title: Set a title for each page
tests: Run the code inspector of the browser
Inspect the page title (<title>[title]</title>)
or read the title from the browser tab
verifier: Check that the page title is filled in
Verify that the page title is unique, it must allow the user to understand the context of the page
resultat:
Each page has a unique and descriptive title,
from the most precise to the most general.
example : [page content summary - site name]

title: Give headings to sections of content
tests: Launch Wave > Outline
Inspect the headings hierarchy
verifier: Check that the headings are relevant and not empty
Check that the headings follow each other in a logical sequence
Check for skipping heading ranks
resultat: All content, visually treated as headings, has a heading semantics (<h1> to <h6> tags)
The level headings are structured in a logical way
exception: Do not take into account hidden headings (visibility:hidden or display:none) via CSS directives. If one of these masked titles is likely to appear, observations on the new structure of the titration must be made again.

title: Use HTML semantics
tests: Disable page styles: Under Firefox > View > Page style > No style
Run the code inspector of the browser
Inspect the content
verifier:
Check that appropriate HTML semantics are used to markup content, including:
  • list (see details next step)
  • quote (presence of <blockquote> or <q> when necessary)
  • link (<a>), for any change of context via loading a new URL
  • button (<button>, <input type='button'>), for any triggering of an action, validation or selection
resultat: All content, visually treated as lists, has a semantic HTML list (<ol> for ordered lists, <ul> for non-ordered lists)
All quotes have HTML quotation list semantics
All interactive elements that cause a context change via URL loading, have HTML link semantics (<a>)
All interactive elements allowing the triggering of an action, validation or selection, have HTML button semantics (<button>, <input type='button'>)

title: Use HTML semantics / list semantics
tests: Disable CSS page styles: Under Firefox > View > Page style > No style
Run the code inspector of the browser
Inspect the lists
verifier: Check that the page uses HTML lists
Check for the absence of a list of a single item
Check for the absence of an empty list
resultat: Existence of relevant enumeration lists

title: Use HTML semantics / HTML validation
tests: Validate the page in the W3C validator
verifier:
At least check:
  • elements have start and end tags,
  • elements are nested according to their specifications,
  • elements do not contain duplicate attributes,
  • each id is unique
resultat: All the elements present in the beginning and end tags
All elements are nested according to their specification
No element contain duplicated attributes
No duplicated id attributes

title: Declaring the main language and language changes / main language
tests: Run the code inspector of the browser
Inspect the <html> element
verifier: Check for the presence of a lang attribute
The value of the lang attribute must match the main language of the document
resultat: A language attribute is present in the <html> element of the page
The value of the lang attribute matches to the main language of the document

title: Declaring the main language and language changes / language switch
tests: Run the code inspector of the browser
Inspect foreign language terms
verifier: Check that a language attribute is present for the foreign language words and expressions
resultat:
The lang attribute must be present in the element encapsulating the text.
ex : <q lang='en'>[...]</q>
exception: For words or expressions in a foreign language that have passed into common use (Google, newsletter...) or proper names, do not indicate a change of language.

title: Structure data tables
tests: Run the code inspector of the browser
Locate the table by searching on the term table
Inspect the table
verifier: Check that the tables are not used for layout purposes

For data tables:
Check that the data tables have a non-empty caption element, or a heading placed just before the table

Single entry table:
Check for the presence of headers (th) for simple tables

Table with 2 entries:
For each th check the presence of an attribute scope='col' for column headers,
and the presence of a scope='row' for row headers

Complex tables:
Check for the presence of th headers or attributes id and headers

Check the presence of a summary explaining the structure of the table.
HTML5: presence of a summary, if necessary in accessible masking or display:none.
The summary is linked to the table via a aria-describedby
Previous version: summary present in an attribute summary
resultat: Tables are used only for data presentation
The tables have a legend (caption or heading placed just before)
Simple tables have th headers
Double entry tables have th headers as well as scope='col' and scope='row' attributes
Complex tables have headers (th + scope attributes) or complex headers based on the use of attributes id and headers
Complex tables have a relevant summary

title: Define text alternatives for images and frames / images
tests: Launch aXe
verifier: Check that all images have an attribute alt
Check that all iframe and frame contain a non-empty title attribute
resultat: No error due to the absence of alt attribute
No error due to the absence of title attribute on frame and iframe
exception: Presence of an attribute alt for all images
Presence of an attribute title for all frame and iframe

title: Set a text alternatives for images and frames / background
tests:
Disable page styles
Firefox > Display > Page style > No style
verifier: Check that there is no loss of information due to the absence of integrated background images (CSS)
resultat: No information-carrying images inserted in CSS

title: Set a text alternatives for images and frames / alternatives for images
tests: Run the code inspector of the browser
Inspect the images
verifier: Manually check that the value of the alt attributes is relevant:

Image link:
check that the alt attribute of each link image is relevant to its link function

Information-carrying image:
check that the alt attribute of each image is relevant to the role of the image in the page

Image containing text:
check that the alt attribute includes at least the text of the image

Decorative image:
check that the alt attribute is empty

Complex image whose content of the alt would be too long (schematics, graphs...)
Check that for any image description too long to be put in an attribute alt, the description of the image in html text form is either present in the page or a link points to an html page containing the description, and this, near the image to be described
resultat: Image link: the target of the link is specified in the alt
Image carrier of information: the alt attribute contains the information conveyed by the image
Image containing text: the alt attribute contains text conveyed by the image
Decorative image: the alt attribute is empty
Complex image: a description of the image is available in the form of a text, either directly in the page or accessible via a link near the image

title: Set a text alternatives for images and frames / alternatives for frames
tests: Run the code inspector of the browser
Inspect the frames
verifier: Verify that the value of the title attributes describes the content or function of iframe or frame
resultat: All frames have a relevant title attribute

title: Provide accessible audio or video tracks
tests: Inspect the audio and video content of the page
verifier:
Verify that for any audio or video track, a complete transcript
(text containing all visual and auditory information)
in html text form is either present in the page,
or through a link (near the element) to a html page containing this transcript
Check that for any video, subtitles are available
Check that an audio description is available for videos presenting information in visual form
resultat: Presence of a complete transcript in the same page or in another page via a link
Subtitles in text format are available for all videos and provide all the information of the soundtrack

An audio description is present in addition to the audio tape.
This one presents in text format, the information is accessible only by the image.

title: Provide accessible audio or video tracks / auto-play
tests: Inspect the audio and video content of the page
verifier: Make sure no audio or video tracks is automatically played when the page is launched.
resultat: Audio and video tracks do not start automatically when the page is loaded.

title: Provide accessible audio or video tracks / accessible control mechanisms
tests: Inspect the audio and video content of the page
verifier: Check for each audio or video track that there is a control mechanism (pause, play)
Manually check that it is possible to stop/resume playback of an audio or video track with a mouse
Manually check that it is possible to stop/resume playback of an audio or video track with a keyboard
resultat:
A control mechanism for the audio or video track is present.
This mechanism allows the media to be played or paused, regardless of the technical aid used.

title: Provide accessible audio or video tracks / flashes
tests: Inspect the audio and video content of the page
verifier: Make sure that any video does not show rapid flash (more than 3 flashes per second)
resultat: No rapid flash

title: Avoid captchas
tests: Inspect the captcha
verifier:
Verify that for any visual-only or sound-only captcha, at least one of the alternatives below is given:
  • audio + visual captcha
  • logical tests (question whose answer is obvious, simple mathematical test...)
  • There is another solution to access the functionality secured by CAPTCHA
resultat:
The page proposes at least one of the solutions below:
  • captcha audio + visual
  • captcha audio or visual + logical tests (question with obvious answer, simple mathematical test...)

title: Provide enough contrast between text and background / texts
tests: Launch aXe
verifier: Check that the contrast is sufficient to understand the information conveyed by all interactive components, texts
resultat: Presence of sufficiently contrasting elements
exception: Exception on the color pair #F16E00 / #FFFFFFFF, for interfaces implementing the latest version of the Orange brand.

title: Provide enough contrast between text and background / images and components
tests: Launch Color Contrast Analyser
verifier: Verify that text images, graphics, icons, and interactive components have sufficient contrast to transmit information.
resultat: Presence of text in the form of images, graphic objects, icons, and interactive components with sufficient contrast
exception:
Are excluded from the scope:
  • logos
  • if a text, such as a label, a data table, provides the same information as the icon or graphic
  • if the lack of contrast of the image does not prevent the understanding of the content or its function
  • inactive components

title: Do not use colour or sensory characteristics as the unique source of information / color
tests: Identify elements using color
verifier:
Check that color is not the only way to convey information:
at least one other visual means is available to obtain the same information
resultat: Information conveyed by colour can also be obtained by means of an explicit text
The information conveyed by colour is complemented by other visual information (example: icons use different colours, but also different shapes)

title: Do not use colour or sensory characteristics as the unique source of information / other sensory information
tests: Identify elements using sensory information (e.g. position, size, sound) to convey information
verifier: Verify that the information conveyed by sensory information can also be obtained by a text, or an explicit message
resultat: A text, or an explicit message is present to convey the information

title: Link and button labels must be understandable out of context / identical labels
tests: Run the code inspector of the browser
Locate links, buttons and all navigation items

Inspect the text wording of these items,
If the test cannot be validated in step 3, inspect the title and title attributes
verifier: Check that there are no identical labels pointing to different destinations
resultat: Links, buttons and navigation items with identical wording, point to the same target, or do the same action.

title: Link and button labels must be understandable out of context / labels
tests: Run the code inspector of the browser
Locate links, buttons and all navigation items
Inspect the text wording of these items
If the test cannot be validated as early as step 3, inspect the aria-label and title attributes
verifier: Verify that it is possible to determine the action or destination of a link or button, only from its text label
resultat: Links, buttons and navigation items are understandable out of context

title: Warn the user when opening a new window
tests: Run the code inspector of the browser
Locate links, buttons and all navigation items
Inspect the text wording of these items
If the test cannot be validated as early as step 3, inspect the aria-label and title attributes
verifier: Make sure that users are informed when a new window is opened in the text label of the link
resultat:
Presence of a mention specifying the opening of a new window
In general, the text of the link followed by the mention 'new window', if not, the title and aria-label attributes must specify the mention 'new window'.
Example: google (new window)

title: Provide skip links
tests:
Disable page styles
under Firefox > Display > Page style > No style
verifier: Check for the presence of skip links (usually the first links on the page)
resultat: Presence of skip links to access the main parts of the page

title: Ensure that the user keeps control during interactions - On Focus / On Input
tests: Follow an user story within the page (via mouse navigation, then keyboard navigation)
verifier:
When using forms, or any interactive component, check that there is no change of context (modification of all or almost all of the page content, automatic focus movement, opening of a new window):
  • when an element receives focus
  • when entering data
  • when activating a form element other than a button
resultat: Forms are not automatically submitted when an element is focused
The content of the page is not automatically modified (either dynamically or after reloading) as soon as an element takes a focus
Forms are not submitted automatically upon data entry, or the activation of an input other than a button
A new page is not opened as soon as an element is focused

title: Ensuring that the user keeps control during interactions - Content on Hover or Focus
tests: Identify additional content displayed on focus or on mouse hover (e.g. tooltip)
verifier: Verify that the user can move the pointer from the triggering element to the additional content, without closing it
Verify that a mechanism is in place to remove the additional content without having to move the pointer or focus
Check that the content that appeared remains visible as long as the user does not interact with the trigger element and the content remains valid
resultat: The additional content remains displayed when moving the pointer from the trigger element to the new content
The additional content can be removed without the need to move the pointer or focus (e. g. with the <kbd>esc.</kbd> key)
The additional content is persistent until the focus or hover on the triggering element is removed, until the user make it disappear or until the content is no longer valid.

title: Ensure that the user keeps control during interactions - Time Adjustable
tests: Identify whether the user should complete a form or perform actions within a limited time frame.
verifier:
Verify that one of the following actions is possible:
  • disable the timeout
  • increase the time limit
resultat: The user can disable, or increase the timeout duration

title: Ensure that the user keeps control during interactions - Character key shortcut
tests: Identify if shortcuts using a non-printable character are available in the application
verifier:
Check that keyboard shortcuts based on a non-printable character meet one of the following conditions:
  • shortcuts can be disabled by the user
  • shortcuts can be modified, with the possibility of adding 1 or more characters non-printable (Ctrl, Alt, etc.) to the combination
  • shortcuts are only active when focusing on the element
resultat: One or multiple keys shortcuts can be disabled or reprogrammed.
exception: User components (e. g. menu) are not concerned when offering a shortcut only when the focus is on the component, 'accesskey' and keyboard shortcuts using a modification key.

title: Provide multiple access and a location
tests: Browse the page
Identify navigation and search elements
verifier:
Verify that at least 2 of the mechanisms listed below are present on the page, to allow a user to be located within a content tree structure:
  • provide a main navigation menu, presenting the current position of the user
  • provide a table of contents
  • provide a sitemap
  • provide a search mechanism
  • provide a link list to navigate through the entire site
resultat:
2 of the following mechanisms are present on the page:
  • provide a main navigation menu, presenting the current position of the user (be careful, the information must not be based on color only)
  • provide a breadcrumb trail
  • provide a sitemap, table of contents
  • provide a search mechanism
  • provide a link list to navigate through the entire site (in the footer)

title: Provide multiple access and location / location
tests: Browse the page
Identify navigation and search elements
verifier: Verify that the user's current position within a content is visually and programmatically given
resultat: A not only visual indication is present to identify the active content (be careful, the information must not be based on color only)

title: Allow to know the result of a user interaction using status messages
tests: Launch a screen reader
Follow an user story
Trigger status or alert messages (message on interaction results, waiting message, message related to a change of context)
Run the code inspector of the browser
verifier:
Verify that a mechanism based on roles (status, alert, alertdialog...) and/or aria-live dynamic regions is implemented.
Example: Aria and status messages
resultat: Messages are automatically vocalized.

title: Allowing control of animations
tests: Browse the page
Identify any content in motion, automatically updated, flashing or scrolling, and for more than 5 seconds
verifier: Check for each of these contents that a mechanism is present to allow the user to pause/start the animation
Check that this mechanism is accessible with mouse and keyboard
Check that no element of the page contains a fast flash of light (more than 3 repetitions per second)
resultat:
The user can pause/restart the animations or flashes.
The animations do not contain flash.

title: Allow to use the main features of the application with the keyboard
tests: Scroll through the page using the keyboard using the <kbd>tab</kbd> key
verifier: Check that you get a result equivalent to a mouse navigation for the main features of the page
resultat: All interactive elements can be reached from a keyboard navigation
All interactive elements are usable with keyboard interactions

title: Make the focus path sequential and logical without keyboard trap
tests:
Disable page styles
under Firefox > Display > Page style > No style
Scroll through the page using the keyboard using the <kbd>tab</kbd> key
verifier: Checking the order of focus of the elements (buttons, links, form fields) is consistent with the order resulting from the visual aspect
resultat: The keyboard path through the page is logical.

title: Make the focus visible at all times / outline
tests: Scroll through the page using the keyboard using the <kbd>tab</kbd> key
verifier: Verify that the focus received by the different elements (buttons, links, form fields) is visible enough
resultat: The focus indicator is visible on all elements (enough size >1px)

title: Make the focus visible at all times / contrast
tests: Run the code inspector of the browser
Scroll through the page with the keyboard using the <kbd>tab</kbd> key
Identify the color of the focus and the background color
Test with the Color Contrast Analyzer
verifier: Check that the level of contrast between the color of the focus indicator and the background is sufficient.
resultat: The contrast level is sufficient 3:1

title: Use relative sizes and responsive design
tests: Browser > Display > Text only zoom
Zoom to 200%
verifier: Check that there are no truncated / hidden texts or features
resultat: Absence of content and functionality truncated or hidden

title: Use relative sizes and responsive design / Reflow
tests: Sizing the viewport to 320 px CSS wide
verifier: Check that no scroll bars appear horizontally
resultat: Pages designed for vertical scroll (i. e. with horizontal text), do not show a horizontal scrollbar when a display width is set to 320px CSS
exception: Some content such as maps, data tables, games, etc., may require a 2-dimensional scroll.

title: Allow text spacing
tests: Go to our guidelines site
Add the bookmarklet to your favorites
Consult the page
Activate the bookmarklet
verifier:
Spaces are adjusted according to the criteria:
  • The height of the lines must be adjustable to at least 1.5 times the font size
  • The space between two paragraphs must be adjustable to at least 2 times the font size
  • The spacing between the letters must be adjustable to 0.12 times minimum font size
  • The spacing between words must be adjustable to at least 0.16 times the font size
Absence of truncated or superimposed content
resultat:
The spacing has been adjusted according to the criteria.
The texts are not truncated or overlaid.

title: Identify and keep the consistency of the groupings and the different regions of the page
tests: Browse the page
Identify the groups and main regions of the page
verifier: Check that the navigation mechanisms are always located in the same place in a page set
Verify that components and groupings that have the same function are identified (visually and semantically) in the same way

Check that the areas of the page are clearly marked out (borders, frames, sufficient contrast...) or that there is a way to visually distinguish the groups (submenu, drop-down list...) as well as the different regions of the page
resultat: The different regions are clearly identifiable visually.

title: Identify and keep the consistency of the groupings and the different regions of the page / links
tests: Browse the page
Identify the links in the body of the text
verifier: Check that the links in the body of the text are easily visually identifiable by a means other than colour (underlined, bold...) in relation to the rest of the text
resultat: Links are visually identifiable from the text by a means other than colour

title: Identify and keep the consistency of the groupings and the different regions of the page / landmarks
tests: Browse the page
Identify the groupings and main regions of the page
Run the code inspector of the browser
verifier: Verify that each region has semantics through HTML5 structure tags
resultat: The different regions are clearly identifiable programmatically

title: Define sensitive areas of sufficient size
tests: Browse the page
Identify interactive elements
verifier: Check that the size of these elements exceeds 44px by 44px
resultat: All interactive elements have dimensions that exceed 44px by 44px
exception:
• Anchor / internal link to the page
  • Link within a paragraph
  • Link within a sentence
  • Link within a footnote (at the end of a paragraph or sentence
  • A clickable icon within a sentence or paragraph

title: Associate a relevant label to each form field - Label
tests: Launch aXe
verifier:
Check for errors for unlabelled form elements.

One of the following solutions must be implemented, in order of preference:
  • Presence of an <label> element accessible hiding or not, correctly linked to its field
  • Presence of the aria-label attribute
  • Presence of the title attribute
resultat: Presence of, preferably, a label tag or equivalent for every form field

title: Associate a relevant label to each form field - Relevance of labels
tests: Manual test
Browse forms
verifier: Check that the text of the labels (label element, or aria-label attribute, or title attribute) is relevant
resultat: Presence of relevant content in label tag or equivalent for every form field

title: Associate a relevant label to each form field - Data formats
tests: Manual test
Identify each forms
verifier: Check that the label text indicates the data format when necessary.
resultat: Presence of text specifying the input formats

title: Associate a relevant label to each form field - Mandatory field
tests: Manual test
Browse forms
verifier:
Verify that the mandatory fields are visually and programmatically identifiable:
  • the visual identification of the mandatory field is not based only on the color
  • One of the following techniques is implemented to convey the information programmatically:
    • the visual information is integrated into the label. An alternative text is available to convey the information
    • presence of a required attribute
    • presence of an aria-required attribute
resultat: Mandatory fields are visually and programmatically identifiable.

title: Associate a relevant label to each form field - Group
tests: Manual test
Browse forms
verifier:
Verify that fields of the same nature are grouped.

One of the following solutions must be implemented:
  • presence of a fieldset
  • presence of a role='group' attribute (or radiogroup for radio buttons) on the parent element encapsulating the fields
resultat: Fields of the same nature are grouped together.

title: Detect, identify errors and suggest corrections / relevance of messages
tests: Manual test
Browse forms
Fill in forms with incorrect data
Submit forms
verifier: Check that error are identified and error messages relevant
resultat: Errors are detected and messages relevant

title: Detect, identify errors and suggest corrections / identify errors
tests: Manual test
Browse forms
Fill in forms with incorrect data
Submit forms
verifier:
Check that one of the following solutions is implemented:
  • The error message is present before the form.
    The message lists the fields with errors.
    The focus is given to the element containing the error message.
    Anchors allow the user to position themselves on error fields
  • Error messages are added to field labels.
  • Error messages are not put into the labels, but a mechanism is present in order to link fields and errors programmatically: see aria-describedby
resultat: Errors are detected
An accessible mechanism is present to identify errors

title: Allow zooming
tests: Inspect the name='viewport' meta of the header of the page
Or use aXe (recommended for qualifying profiles)
verifier:
Check that for the <meta name=the viewport'>
  • The user-scalable='no' parameter is not present
  • And the maximum-scale parameter is not less than 2
resultat:
The page does not contain in the <meta name='viewport' >
  • The user-scalable='no' parameter
  • And the maximum-scale parameter is not less than 2

title: Allow to cancel the triggering of gestural interactions
tests: Browse interactive elements (hyperlinks, button, input, UI components), with the mouse
verifier: Check that events aren't triggered at the down click
resultat: No event is triggered until the mouse click is released.

title: Allow to cancel the trigger of gesture interactions
tests: Browse interactive elements (hyperlinks, button, input, UI components) with the keyboard
verifier: Check that no events are triggered when the focus is lost (onblur).
resultat: No event is triggered when the interactive element loses focus.

title: Allow to cancel the trigger of gesture interactions
tests: Identify all elements that can be activated by a single point (hyperlinks, button, input, UI components)

Check that at least one condition is true:
  • No Down event
    The down event of the pointer is not used to perform the function
  • Drop or Cancel
    The completion of the function is on the Up, and a mechanism is available to drop the function before the end or to cancel the function once completed
  • Reverse on Up
    The Up event reverses any result of the previous Down event
verifier: If an action must be absolutely triggered on the down event, then check that there is a mechanism to cancel the action.
resultat: A modal window appears asking for confirmation of the action
exception: The function on the Down event is essential, functions that emulate a keyboard or keypad are considered essential.

title: Offer an alternative to complex gestures
tests: Browse the application
Identify multi-pointers interactions (requiring several fingers)
verifier: Check that for any multi-pointers requiring multiple fingers and/or trajectories to perform an action, an alternative requiring a single pointer (a single finger) and no trajectory is available
resultat: Check that for any multi-pointers requiring multiple fingers and/or path-based gestures to perform an action, an alternative requiring a single pointer (a single finger) and no path-based gesture is available

title: Give access to content regardless of screen orientation
tests: View content in portrait orientation
View content in landscape orientation
verifier: Verify that content and functionality are available in both orientations (no loss of information, no truncated elements)

title: Make sure the main features can be used with screen readers
tests: Browse the application
verifier:
Check that all features are available with a screen reader:
  • Content is correctly vocalized
  • Features are usable
resultat: The main features can be used from a screen reader
